values:
Just deleted my work account and my emo/whiny account.
May keep this one - it'll depend on how the next few months go.

Thanks to , I found what I'm getting Ky for either a late birthday present or an early Christmas present this year. Probably one (or a few) of the dragons, since she has model horses already. <3 Favorites so far are:

To quote <lj user=maderr>, "67 GTO, aka the goat. Big engine, big seats, big tires, big trunk. Looks bad ass with faded paint. Built like a tank but can fly."


...
I want!

So, most of you on here already know I'm joining the Army.

For those who missed the memo - there you go.
No, not the Repo Army - I've been part of that since January. And part of Midnight Surgeons since May.

The US Army.


Yes, I've got good reasons for it.
No, I'm not going to post them here.

If you're really curious, buy me a drink sometime, and we'll talk about it. ^.^


But regardless, took the ASVAB a few weeks ago, and just got my results - 97%.
On a 3 hour, 9 part exam.
Where the entry requirement is 31%.

Damn.

^.^


Unfortunately, I did so well that the ASVAB can't tell me what I'll be good at.
There goes the aptitude part of it. :-p

So now I'm on the weight-loss and fitness program the recruitment center has, to make sure I'll get where I need to go. Tuesdays and Thursdays now suck as much as humanly possible; Wednesdays and Fridays suck residually; and the weekends are still my favorite time of the month, since I've been spending it with two very sweet individuals. :-)







Kyleen's at her grandmother's until September 1st - I'm hoping to get a chance to visit her before that, since I miss her a lot, but I also need to keep up on things like bills, and groceries. :-p Yay, balancing priorities! *grr*




So far, the tentative ship out date is October 1st - I highly doubt that's my precise ship date, but at least it's something to aim for. They'll let me know the precise date closer to it, and all I can do is stay calm and train for it. *slightly anxious grin*

So, y'all have me until my birthday - in theory. Sept 29th.
Who wants to hang out?

Contemplating many things...

Some of which will lead to major upheaval, but may be for the best.

I'm trying to think of it much like how you need to strip a bed to properly make the bed, as opposed to tearing down a building to rebuild the foundation, but it's still a major change.

And one I won't be able to guarantee is for the best.

My gut feelings don't always pan out, after all.

Your Result: You attract artsy people!

If you seek logical decision making skills and good money management, you may want to change something in the way you appear. Artsy people are fun for adventure and exploring, so, have fun! Which Website are You?

Thank you, LOLrepo! *snorts* If you have no idea what this is from, look up "Repo! Genetic Opera" on YouTube, and curse my name later if you have a queasy stomach or no tolerance for operas and horror movies! :-D

This is my first Christmas, since Ken and I broke up... And I'm always a little home-sick, especially this time of year, but it's a little lonely - Kyleen's been staying with Grandma for the past week or so, and will be there for a bit longer until Ken and I work out something stable for her. (And stop being quite so angry with each other) So... for entertainment's sake, here are a few of the things that made me laugh from the Trinidadian-LJ group I joined today. You're a Trini when...
  • You refer to an avocado as a "zaboca"
  • You get "vexed" not "angry"
  • You point with your lips
  • You could wine and get on bad
  • You wash "wares" after a meal
  • You call hanging out "liming"
  • You call all hot drinks "tea"
  • You say 'I don't know' by raising your shoulders [My grandmother would get mad if I ever did that instead of answering.]
  • You shorten your sentences like "Whayahsatin" or "Whahappenin"
  • You refer to pop and soda as "sweet drinks"
  • You say 'Old Year's Night' instead of 'New Year's Eve'
  • You show disappointment by "steupsing" [What real Trini doesn't 'suck their teeth'?]
  • You speak of leaving your hair "open" instead of "loose"
  • You reach where you're going at least an hour late
  • You like eating doubles at breakfast
  • You say "twentay" (20) instead of "twentee" like the rest of the world
  • You say 'boy' to everyone, but usually at the beginning of a sentence
  • You call people by saying "pssst"
  • You nod your head upwards to greet someone
  • You call any hard candy "sweetie"
  • You end a sentence with "man"
  • You start gearing down for the weekend by lunchtime on Friday
You know you're a Trini if...
    • Yuh refer to all salt crackers as "Crix".
      • Yuh know the meaning of the word "obzokie".
    • Yuh own a cutlass.
    • Yuh know how to "scootch" somebody.
    • Yuh can name at least 3 types of mangoes.
    • Yuh call everybody "dread"
    • Yuh know what a "grip" is and struggle to keep it under 70 lbs. when yuh goin` back home.
    • Yuh know dat to "cuff" and "box" are fightin adjectives.
    • Yuh call every bee, wasp, or hornet a "Jack Spaniard".
    • Yuh pronounce San Juan: "Sah-Wah"
    • Yuh tired of hearin "Who let de dogs out?" cause yuh know de original by Anslem is de REAL thing.
    • Old dub songs like "Ram-Ram" brings back some special memories.
    • When yuh leave yuh does "ride out" and yuh coming back "in a timing."
    • When yuh crossing de road, and cars speeding toward yuh, yuh does say "Well bonx meh nah!"
    • Yuh don't look at traffic lights when crossing de road.
    • Yuh does say, "Ah tell yuh!", even when someone else is telling you the story.
    • Yuh put salt on every citrus fruit yuh eat to make it sweeter.
    • Yuh can avoid potholes with true skills.
    • Yuh grow up on Klim, Milo, Horlicks or Ovaltine.
    • Speaking of that, yuh remember eating Ovaltinees, Smarties, Catch bars and Cheers candy?
    • Every carbonated beverage is called a "sweet drink"
    • A good lime is not a citrus fruit.
    • "A beer is a....." (fill in the rest)
    • "Donkey's years" means a very long time.
    • Yuh clap with everybody else when de BWEE plane finally land in Piarco (not Port-of-Spain).
    • Yuh know what cokie-eye is.
    • Yuh call it a "car park" instead of parking lot.
    • Yuh call chewing gum "ching gum"
    • Yuh always seem to meet someone yuh knew in secondary school or dey cousin went to school with you.
    • De bone taste jus as good as de meat.
    • "Haul yuh tail!" have nothing to with a moving truck....ENT??
    • Yuh give directions with your hands... even if it's in another state (yuh jus go up de road and when yuh see...)
    • Yuh go to parties for the food... and the word free never quite had the same meaning.
    • Yuh nod your head upwards to greet someone... and sideways when the joke stale.
    • Your recipe for making orange juice is plenty water, plenty sugar, plenty ice and only 2 orange... and "ah pak ah red kool-aid tuh stretch it..."
    • Yuh say "boy" at the beginning of a sentence and "man" at the end of it... and the words "yes we" doesn't refer to any people...
    • Yuh hate to wait in long lines, a habit you adopted from the days of pushing to get into "pit" to see a movie.
    • 'Priority' doesn't have anything to do with what you have to do right away.
    • Yuh always turn around when someone says "Psssssssst"... except for when you make out the person first and you're duckin' them.
    • Yuh say "Soooo looooong" instead of "Yes, I'm done" when somebody asked you if you finished the job already.
    • Yuh have "knick knacks" all over your home... and a glass cabinet or a space saver to put them in.
    • Yuh put ketchup and peppersauce on your pizza. Anchovies? Yuh losin it or what?
    • Yuh make a drink and ice cream with peanut butter but you never put it on bread with jelly... but you might put it on your dixie biscuits.
    • Your cupboards are full of canned corned beef, pepper sauce and red beans and baked beans ...and a dry coconut for the pelau.
    • Yuh think steak is a waste of good meat. Yuh rather cut it up and stew it with some potatoes instead ... or curry it and make roti.
    • "What goin on these days?" and "I jus dey" mean "Hello, how are you?" and I'm fine" respectively.
    • Yuh think your rum and Carib beer are the best in the world and you hate it when nobody heard of them.
    • Yuh put ice in your beer ...and you chew the ice when you're finished with the beer.
    • Yuh say "Old Years' night"
    • "Dis August holidays" actually start in July.
    • Yuh show disappointment / disgust by sucking on your teeth (steupsing)
    • Yuh still call a soda a "sweet drink" and an avocado, a "zaboca"
    • Yuh go to the shoprite clerk and ask them "wey allyuh have de breez?" meaning "where is the laundry detergent?".
    • Yuh say "whappenin" even at a funeral.
    • Yuh tell the host "Good Night" when you arrive at someone's home in the evening.
    • Yuh wash the "wares" after having dinner.
    • When someone sympathises with you, you comment "Yuh think it easy?"
    • Yuh refer to all sweet coloured juice as "Kool-Aid"
    • Yuh call a quarter a "shilling" when this really means 24 cents.
    • Yuh know that using "blue" makes white clothes whiter.
    • Just because something is called a "bake" you don't assume that it indicates the way it was cooked.
    • Yuh have at least one relative living in either England, Canada, or the US.
    • Yuh know that a washy-kong bears no relationship to King Kong.
    • Yuh have cancelled plans because of rain even when you're going to be indoors ...Rain is also a legitimate reason to be late for a rendez-vous... or to miss work.
    • Yuh know someone with a gold tooth.
    • Yuh know someone with their name either on their belt buckle or their chain.
    • All vaccinations are called injections.
    • Yuh are able to recite at least one (or several) line(s) from Sesame Street.
    • Yuh have been to at least one party where you have seen the sun rise.
    • Yuh know the meanings of: "washing wares"; "straightening a room"; "bodice"; "sucking yuh teeth"; "cut-eye"; "hot foot"; "bouff".
    • All dish washing detergents are called "Squeezy".
    • Yuh still give people (youself included) "meggies".
    • A rubber is an eraser.
    • Yuh know of at least one person who wakes up at 4am to LISTEN to cricket from Australia / New Zealand on the RADIO.
    • Yuh can feel cold when it's 25°C.
    • No matter how old you are, you still call your parents Mummy and Daddy.
    • Yuh still eat fries with ketchup AND MUSTARD.
    • Yuh call fries "chips".
    • Yuh pronounce words in plural, even though it's meant to be singular, eg."gimme ah COKES" or "ah GRAPES".
    • Yuh say "FLIM" (film), "AXE" (ask) or "PITCH-YEAR"(picture), "STATELLITE" (satellite), "CUTLASH" (cutlass). .
    • Yuh know what "Wukking a 10-days" is, and know darn well it's going to take much longer than 10 days.
    • Yuh know that a lime is not necessarily a fruit.
    • Yuh call little kids "po po" or "beta" and your girl/boyfriends "daahlin" or "punkin".
    • Yuh call any older woman "Tantie" and any older man "Uncle", regardless of whether or not they are related to you or even know you.
    • Yuh could sing an entire Parang song in Spanish word for word, but don't speak or understand a word of Spanish.
    • Yuh know who "Anansi" and "Papa Bois" are.
    • Yuh love Soca and know the meanings of RAMAJAY and DINGOLAY.
    • When in doubt of how to prepare something to eat ... CURRY is the always the solution.
    • Yuh know Trinis will curry any and everything (not just meat) even mango, fish, conch, chataigne, etc...
    • Yuh can take anything and make "chow" with it.
    • Yuh know what "chow" is.
    • Yuh can call your fellow "countryman" by an ethnic name and it would be okay, eg. chinee-man, creole, doegs, or pyol.
    • When you ask for PEPPER you don't mean ground black pepper.
    • Yuh get "licks" already with a guava/hibiscus whip :(

An animated introduction to Repo: The Genetic Opera - Or, as their website describes it, "This is not your parents' opera!" To the squeamish, perhaps the animated version will convey the movie's gruesomeness in a distant enough fashion to explain my new addiction without having to worry about getting queasy by the realistic street-surgery entailed within the movie itself. (I do have a few squeamish-types friended to this LJ, so trying to be considerate of the non-violent among us) :-D "Graaaaaaaaaaaaaves!"

Kyleen - right before dinner and bed - I was babysitting (a.k.a. needed a Mommy fix).
Left, regular Kyleen; Right, headbanging to Bob-the-Builder theme music:


Left, attempting to steal the phone; Right, hiding from the camera-phone noise:

Cruxshadows - Birthday
Dracula's Ball and Nocturne, at Shampoo? Open bar from 9 to 11? Cruxshadows? Somebody has to want to go! I know I do! :-D

Haven't been on here much lately... http://www.repo-opera.com had a showing here in Philly on Sunday... A client was supposed to get tickets, but then flaked - thankfully, philly_goth (the LJ group) helped out and someone had an extra ticket. I have no words for how much I love this movie. But if you like Sarah Brightman's voice, you will not want to miss her songs here, and if you are anything but white-bread brain-dead "normal", you will love this film! This is the song, Chase the Morning, but it's not a music video - it's a clip from the movie... the whole movie has the larger-than-life music-video-meets-horror-movie operatic feel to it that I love! CHASE THE MORNING
I am so glad that another client just bought me the soundtrack, and is lined up to get me the DVD when it comes out January 20th. Now if only they come back to Philly for another showing, or I can arrange travel plans to find the next showing I can get to!
11/30/08 - you wouldn't guess that she's only 2 1/2.

No, "Link" doesn't have a mohawk in these clips... But the guy playing him has a very impressive one most of the time. And looks good in eyeliner. And a dress. (Yes, my pansexual tendencies come out more when I find manly men who are comfortable in eyeliner and dresses or skirts, or women who look good in wifebeaters and car-related stains) Mmm... >:D Part 1: and Part 2: http://www.youtube.com/user/pyrotechc3h8

Spread the Word
Join the Impact -- Protest Prop 8 on November 15thOn the steps of your City Hall on November 15th at 10:30am PST / 1:30pm EST, our community will take to the streets and speak out against Proposition 8 and all of the other pro-equality losses that we have faced in our lifetimes, in our parents’ lifetimes, and for many generations before us. WE CAN’T DO THIS ALONE! WE NEED YOUR HELP! We need organizers in every major city to work with us and get out the protest! I know you’re all tired from all of the work you’ve done for this great election year, but I’m asking for one more push! Let the country hear our voices together. Let them see that we are a strong, adamant, and powerful community that deserves equal rights, and CAN’T BE DEFEATED! Get the word out Protest Locations Local contacts for your city
I have to admit it - I really want to go. But since I have Kyleen that weekend, and I'm not taking a two year old to the mess and potential riot that will turn into... I'm conflicted. Responsible bisexual adult, with a voice and a presence... Responsible mother, who hasn't seen her daughter in over two weeks... (Yeah, babysat tonight - i.e. went to sleep in the other room; the girls were already asleep; so still haven't seen Ky) Mothering wins out every time, but the conflicted part is because I can't be sure that my perspective that I need to be with Kyleen this weekend (which is the precursor - the given - to why it is that she then obviously can't be in the middle of that mess if Philly has one of it's infamous riots) is for her own good or for mine. To clarify, since that sentence looks a little convoluted, even to me - not asking advice. Just venting, and putting my thoughts down in writing, so that hopefully in the morning, things will look a little clearer.

Thank you for apologizing.
Thank you for calling when I know it had to be difficult.
I'm sorry for anything hurtful I've said in turn, in the past.
Thank you for being willing to put things behind us and start anew.


Miss you, lady!
*hug*

Wow.

(Probably because I haven't seen this movie in about 10 or 15 years!) *sleep-dep. giggling*

Found this while trying to make myself feel less icky. (For future reference, waking up at 6 a.m. to cut the lawn at a house you don't even live at, and then having to sprint from the front door to projectile vomit everything you ate - and a few things you don't remember eating - for the next few hours is not one of my favorite memories... and dry heaves fucking hurt, after a while!!!) Reminds me of Ken, sometimes... Not often these days, thankfully.

Today's been... odd.

Not bad...
But not good either.

Ending on a really odd note too.


K&j to go out and have fun; I stay over to watch things.
K comes back in not too much later, and closes master bedroom door (or, rather, opens closet door to block out light - same thing).
No sign of j.
No response to query.
So I go home.


Do I poke my nose in, and see if I can help, or do I mind my own business?
It's hard to do this - there are no clear boundaries.
We're supposed to be doing the 'just friends' routine, but I have a child with him and I care about them both.
*head-to-desk*
And yet, on the third hand, they're in an M/s relationship - so trying to help can be seen as interfering where I have no business to...
*headache*

"My own family was curious about the no sex thing. They couldn't understand why people would do something like that and then NOT have sex during or after. I mentioned some of the things that humans do that are fun and a rush but don't culminate in sex - sky diving, lap dances, motorcycle rides, rollercoasters, dancing, bungee jumping, martial arts - and they nodded. It's not an explanation that works for everyone."

She peels!


*laughs*

I'm nowhere near as bad as K. or J.
Or, rather, nowhere near as red and peeling.

My right shoulder has a speckled tan, because of little kid fingerprints in my sunscreen that day last weekend.
And my back has an oval sunburn from my sports swimsuit.

I may resign myself to my mom's advice, and just get a white bathingsuit.
After all, if it goes transparent when wet, I'll just get more attention.
*laughs*

Very mature, to freeze replies to that one response. I am only now using that photo set because Ken and Jezz have been busy at work, and they do my photos and photo editing. I've been in Florida for the past week. And before that, I had to deal with Ken's father's cancer treatments. So no - the universe still doesn't revolve around you. I'm not saying you've taken anything of mine. I'm saying both of us are missing things, and I'm not getting pissy about it. I never said you two were "apparently *SO* fucking crazy for accusing her of stealing" - I said it was hurtful, since I didn't accuse you two (or anyone) when my things went missing, and yet that was the first assumption you both leapt to. So easily too. Which is why I wondered in the yahoo group what our entire partnership was based on, because friendships and trust don't fracture quite that easily. As for the various other points: 1. An inability to measure is fine - my showing you over the course of an entire day and your doing it incorrectly is referred to as a mistake because you learned how to do it. If that is what you refer to as wielding something "like some sort of sword", what do you think your entire post above and in response to my answer, look like to me? 2. I've taken you out to dinner, and bought you drinks when I don't drink alcohol - I never once asked you for money back for gas when driving you around in the years I've known you - Speculation about a student's crush does not pedophilia make - And yes, you are great at helping your friends, and you are amazingly quick to cut people off and assume the worst of them too. At least, that's what it seems to me, as I've known you for about five years I think, and this is the first bit of conflict I've had with either one of you, and yet you were both willing to simply jump to conclusions, and assume my speculations were excuses rather than trying to figure out what happened without pointless accusations. As for your last point... That's nice - you both simply ceased talking to me - how am I supposed to know what's going on, when all I hear from you both is snippy comments in your blogs, and absolutely no direct contact? So no, not "thanks to (me)". Not psychic. Already said I'd pay you both. Not my problem if your pride made that difficult. As I mentioned several times, the offer still stands - it always has. If you both prefer the legal route, that is certainly up to you. I've made several attempts at an olive branch, but you both seem convinced that I must admit to stealing things I didn't. If I swiped simple things like tools, and whatever you two are convinced is missing, wouldn't it have been simpler to just drop them off at the space and go "Oops?" I can't say it in any smaller words: I. Didn't. Take. Your. Things!

And it's just too funny for a country music video!

If anyone still thinks it's creepy of me to have a pet ball python and think he's so cute as a baby (only a foot and a half long - barely wraps three times around my wrist), then click here, but only if you liked "Eight Legged Freaks". Arachnaphobes - don't click, please. I don't want to deal with the fallout if y'all have simultaneous heart attacks. Hee!

Lets101 - Free Online Dating

I haven't seen this side of me in years... Part of me says getting a vanilla job would help. And the rest of me says that sticking with what I do will get us out of debt faster, which would help more in the long run. *tired and confused*

MoonLight is now my favorite show - and I've only seen the first two episodes. Cute-without-being-pretty, suffering vampire, with a prediliction for single-malt scotch and romance. And violence. Mmmmm Episode 1 Episode 2 Thank you, CBS, for putting the past episodes on your website.

Scraped my foot all to hell at the pool yesterday morning... It's actually kind of funny, in hindsight. Got a good rush going... nothing like cutting through the water. All of a sudden, there's a shape moving into my peripheral vision. I cut to the side, to avoid hitting an old lady. And promptly catch my foot in the pool ladder, banging (and tearing skin from) the middle toe of my left foot on the underside of one of the steps. It stings, and I hate injuring my feet, because it almost never happens so it's a near-blinding pain when it does happen, since it's very much a sensation I'm not used to. But a few deep breaths (and much apologies from the elderly water-therapy group I share the pool with in the wee hours of the morning, and many thanks from the lady I had the near-miss with), and I just kept going for the rest of the hour. Good thing too... Turns out the chlorine kept it from bleeding until I got to the showers, and then blood all over the shower stall floor. Really don't need to think about shower floor germs. Just really glad I wear flip flops there. :-p Further investigation shows a nice, thick vein just under the surface. Another fraction of a millimeter, and I'd have probably been bleeding right into the pool. And they just cleaning it Friday. Hehe... Shark trails, I don't need. So now I'm trying to figure out the rest of my day, sans excessive walking. I can walk. I can stand. Flexing my toes is a bad idea, and even the subway vibration was painful yesterday. But we'll see. No swimming today, of course, but hopefully I'll be back on track tomorrow. Maybe get a pack of waterproof band-aids? :-p
So... Resident Evil - Sept 21st...? Babysitting volunteers? People wanting to go see it opening night? Must have contacts like her "umbrella" corp. ones. *happy twitching*
I mourn. Anyone who knows me knows why.

Ken joked yesterday, at Target, about having to keep me from setting fire to the Bratz merchandise...

No, not for work purposes (although that'd be funny...  drive up, past the people-as-statues and the huge chess match with people in armor)...

But I love animals - I'd choose fake fur over real fur any day of the week (example being My new faux-ivory mink coat that I adore and hope to arrive any day now - thanks, random fanboy!!!)

And I am now missing Wolf something awful (for anyone who hasn't paid attention...  he was done being resocialized early, and was adopted by a loving family who'd lost their husky to old age a year or two ago...  got pictures from the last snow-fall of Wolf running outside with his mouth open - a huge backyard makes for a much happier dog)...  so I came across this website browsing for exotic pets...

http://www.juliesjungle.com/nigeriangoat.php - cute little lawn mowers...  and cuddly too!

http://www.juliesjungle.com/caracals.php - I miss My ocelots!  (Look them up, silly boys - they aren't endangered back home)

http://www.juliesjungle.com/fennecfox.php - Like purse dogs (think Paris Hilton's little yappy critter), but smart...  and actually cute!

And knowing just how much these babies cost, and how much it will cost to have a house and land, and proper habitation for these cuties...  Serious, I'm going to start a church of my own and start tithing My worshippers!







No - seriously!

Law of Cat Inertia
     A cat at rest will tend to remain at rest, unless acted upon by some outside force, such as the opening of cat food or a nearby scurrying mouse.<hr>Law of Cat Motion
     A cat will move in a straight line, unless there is a really good reason to change direction.<hr>Law of Cat Magnetism
     All blue blazers and black sweaters attract cat hair in direct proportion to the darkness of the fabric.<hr>Law of Cat Thermodynamics
     Heat flows from a warmer to a cooler body, except in the case of a cat, in which case all heat flows to the cat.<hr>Law of Cat Stretching
     A cat will stretch to a distance proportional to the length of the nap just taken.<hr>Law of Cat Sleeping
     All cats must sleep with people whenever possible, in a position as uncomfortable for the people involved, and as comfortable as possible for the cat.<hr>Law of Cat Elongation
     A cat can make her body long enough to reach just about any counter top that has anything remotely interesting on it.<hr>Law of Cat Obstruction
     A cat must lay on the floor in such a position to obstruct the maximum amount of human foot traffic.<hr>Law of Cat Acceleration
     A cat will accelerate at a constant rate, until he gets good and ready to stop.<hr>Law of Dinner Table Attendance
     Cats must attend all meals when anything good is served.<hr>Law of Rug Configuration
     No rug may remain in its naturally flat state for very long.<hr>Law of Obedience Resistance
     A cat's resistance varies in proportion to a human's desire for her to do something.<hr>First Law of Energy Conservation
     Cats know that energy can neither be created nor destroyed and will, therefore, use as little energy as possible.
